title: The Graduate
description: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older, married mistress and her daughter.

title: Bonnie and Clyde
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
description: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with ex-con Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

title: Cool Hand Luke
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
description: A man who refuses to conform to life in a rural prison camp becomes a symbol of hope to the other inmates.

title: In the Heat of the Night
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Leading Role
Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium
description: A black Philadelphia police detective is mistakenly suspected of a local murder while passing through a racially hostile Mississippi town, and after being cleared is reluctantly asked to investigate the case.

title: The Jungle Book
description: The story of a young boy raised in the jungle by wolves, who is befriended by a bear and a panther.

title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Leading Role
Best Writing, Story and Screenplay - Written Directly for the Screen
description: A liberal white couple's progressive attitudes are put to the test when their daughter brings home her black fiancé.

title: The Dirty Dozen
description: A U.S. Army major is assigned a dozen convicted murderers to train and lead them into a mass assassination mission of German officers in World War II.

title: You Only Live Twice
description: James Bond and the Japanese secret service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of spacejackings before nuclear war is provoked.

title: Le Samouraï
description: A professional hitman finds himself in a cat-and-mouse game with the police and his employers.

title: Wait Until Dark
description: A recently blinded woman is terrorized by a trio of thugs while they search for a heroin-stuffed doll they believe is in her apartment.

title: Camelot
oscars_won_details: Best Music, Scoring of Music, Adaptation or Treatment
description: The story of the marriage of England's King Arthur to Guinevere. The plot of illegitimate Mordred to gain the throne and Guinevere's growing attachment to Sir Lancelot, threaten to topple Arthur and his "Round Table."

title: Point Blank
description: After being double-crossed and left for dead, a mysterious man named Walker violently wreaks vengeance on his former partners.

title: Two for the Road
description: A couple in the south of France non-sequentially spin down the highways of memory, examining their twelve years of marriage.

title: In Cold Blood
description: The true story of two ex-convicts who break into a Kansas farm home, tie up the family of four, and murder them.

title: To Sir, with Love
description: An idealistic engineer-trainee and his experiences in teaching a group of unruly white high school students from the slums of London's East End.

title: The Taming of the Shrew
description: A wealthy Paduan merchant is trying to marry off his two daughters, but the younger, beautiful one cannot be married before her older, shrewish sister.

title: Doctor Dolittle
description: A veterinarian who can talk to animals goes on a quest to find the legendary Great Pink Sea Snail.

title: Belle de Jour
description: A beautiful but frigid young housewife decides to spend her weekday afternoons as a prostitute.

title: The Producers
oscars_won_details: Best Writing, Story and Screenplay - Written Directly for the Screen
description: A failing producer and his accountant scheme to produce a Broadway flop and make off with the investors' money.

title: Far from the Madding Crowd
description: The story of a beautiful and independent young woman in Victorian England who is courted by three very different men.

title: Barefoot in the Park
description: A newlywed couple's blissful marriage is tested when they move into a small, fifth-floor walk-up apartment in New York City.

title: The Fearless Vampire Killers
description: A bumbling professor and his inept assistant travel to a remote Transylvanian village to hunt vampires.

title: Thoroughly Modern Millie
description: A young woman from a small town moves to New York City in the 1920s to marry a wealthy man, but her plans are complicated by a series of comic misadventures.

title: Casino Royale

director.name: Ken Hughes, John Huston, Joseph McGrath, Robert Parrish, Val Guest

description: In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.

title: The President's Analyst
description: The President's psychiatrist becomes a target for spies and counterspies when he gets tired of the stress of the job.

title: Playtime
description: Monsieur Hulot wanders through a futuristic, high-tech Paris.

title: The Trip
description: A television commercial director takes his first LSD trip.

title: Samurai Rebellion
description: In 18th-century Japan, a samurai defies his feudal lord and risks his life to protect his family.

title: The Young Girls of Rochefort
description: Two sisters, a dance instructor and a music teacher, dream of finding love and fame in Paris.

title: Branded to Kill
description: The number three killer in Japan is hired by a mysterious woman to do a job, but he soon finds himself the target of the number one killer.

title: Closely Watched Trains
description: During the German occupation of Czechoslovakia, a young man working at a train station finds himself embroiled in a plot to blow up a German munitions train.

title: Bedazzled
description: A meek man sells his soul to the devil for seven wishes, but the devil finds a way to twist each wish into a comic disaster.

title: How I Won the War
description: An inept British officer leads his platoon through a series of misadventures in World War II.

title: Hombre
description: A white man raised by Apaches must confront his own divided loyalties when he and a group of strangers are attacked by outlaws.

title: The War Wagon
description: A man who was framed and sent to prison returns to seek revenge on the man who wronged him and steal a shipment of gold.

title: El Dorado
description: A gunfighter comes to the aid of an old friend, a drunken sheriff, in a range war.

title: A Countess from Hong Kong
description: A Russian countess stows away in the cabin of an American diplomat on a cruise ship.

title: The Valley of the Dolls
description: Three young women in show business fall prey to the pressures of fame and fortune.

title: The St. Valentine's Day Massacre
description: The story of the 1929 Chicago massacre, in which Al Capone's men gunned down seven members of a rival gang.

title: The Comedians
description: A group of people in Haiti under the brutal Duvalier regime find their lives intersecting in unexpected ways.

title: Dragon Inn
description: During the Ming dynasty, the emperor's minister of defense is framed by a corrupt eunuch and executed, and his children are exiled. As the children are being escorted to the border, the eunuch plots to have them killed.
